text: it was supposed to be a relaxing holiday
with friends and family but Michael
Schumacher was airlifted to hospital
after he hit his head on a rock just
days before the new year
the former Formula One driver was used
to going fast on the slopes as well as
the track but the speed of his recovery
is much slower than many were hoping
leading neurosurgeons in the UK say it's
unusual to be kept in a medically
induced coma for more than two weeks and
his doctors could be worried about chest
infections and breathing problems our
French colleagues tend to ventilate
patients with their head injuries much
longer than we do here but I certainly
wouldn't discount the possibility of mr.
Schumacher for example still having a
reasonable recovery from this the
hospital where Michael Schumacher's
being treated is a specialist Centre for
people with brain injuries he was joined
on the ward by this British patient
Fernando Greece I have nothing but
praise for the doctors and the care that
I was given and the French are very very
thorough but the longer doctors keep
Michael Schumacher in a medically
induced coma the less likely it is he'll
make anything like a full recovery his
former team Ferrari say they're still
getting daily messages from fans around
the world and hoping he will manage to
pull through Madi Savage BBC news
